antiPatterns.name: Big Bang
antiPatterns.description: A strategy often preferred by large vendors where an entire system is built "at once".
antiPatterns.consequences: Creating a large system in a Big Bang may lead to poorly understood requirements and inconsistencies in the architecture. Communication between and integration of services may be inefficient.
antiPatterns.cause: Due to fine-grained interfaces, services are not independent enough and an incremental development is not possible.
antiPatterns.solution: Coarse grained user-oriented interfaces should be used and required capabilities should be properly decomposed into autonomous services.
